intro: Ruilopezia lopezpalacii, commonly known as the Lopez Palacii grass, is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to the Caribbean. It is a perennial grass characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its flowering stems produce small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
